explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses using machine learning models to predict loan defaults, specifically mentioning several machine learning techniques.
explanations.supervised learning: The models used (Logistic Regression, Linear Discriminant Analysis, K Nearest Neighbors, Decision Tree, Naive Bayes, Support Vector Machine) are all supervised learning methods, as they are trained on labeled data to predict loan repayment.
explanations.classification: The problem of predicting whether a borrower can repay a loan is a classification problem, where the outcome is binary (repay or default).
explanations.support vector machine: The paper explicitly mentions the use of Support Vector Machine (SVM) as one of the models for predicting loan defaults.
explanations.SVM: SVM is an abbreviation for Support Vector Machine, which is mentioned in the paper as one of the models used.
explanations.decision tree: The paper mentions the use of Decision Tree as one of the machine learning models for predicting loan defaults.
